entry.title: FROST ADVISORY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL OREGON COAST
entry.summary: April 17, 2024 4;00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: A Frost Advisory remains in effect through 9:00 a.m. Wednesday for the south-central Oregon coast. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said temperatures as low as 33 degrees will result in frost formation. The Advisory area includes the cities of Reedsport, North Bend and Coos Bay....

entry.title: WYDEN ANNOUNCES TOWN HALL IN DOUGLAS COUNTY
entry.summary: April 17, 2024 3:40 a.m. Senator Ron Wyden has announced that he will hold an in-person town hall in Douglas County. It will be next Wednesday at 1:00 p.m. at Reedsport Community Charter Junior/Senior High School on Longwood Drive. Town halls are also scheduled in Josephine and Curry counties next Tuesday, and in Coos County...

entry.title: HONORING 911 PROFESSIONALS – PUBLIC SAFETY TELECOMMUNICATORS WEEK
entry.summary: April 17, 2024 3:30 a.m. This week is National Public Safety Telecommunicators Week. A release from the Oregon Department of Emergency Management said the annual event honors the essential role emergency response coordination professionals play in keeping the nation’s communities safe and secure. Oregon has 43 standalone 911 centers known as Public Safety Answering Points...

entry.title: ROSEBURG PUBLIC SCHOOLS BUDGET COMMITTEE TO MEET
entry.summary: April 17, 2024 3:20 a.m. The Roseburg Public Schools Budget Committee will meet Wednesday night to discuss the proposed 2024-25 budget. The meeting will begin at 6:00 p.m. in the Administrative Office Boardroom. It can also be accessed via Zoom. Log in information is available on the District’s Business Operations web page.

entry.title: ODFW BIOLOGISTS TO BEGIN NORTH UMPQUA SPRING CHINOOK SALMON

entry.title: COLT FORD SHOW AT DOUGLAS COUNTY FAIR CANCELED
entry.summary: April 16, 2024 2:50 a.m. The Colt Ford show, scheduled for August 9th at the Douglas County Fair has been canceled. A release from the agency representing Ford, said the country-rap star remains in the Intensive Care Unit at a Scottsdale, Arizona hospital following a heart attack after a show in Gilbert, Arizona on April...

entry.title: Public Meeting Notice: Dog Control Board
entry.summary: ROSEBURG, Ore. - The Douglas County Dog Control Board will hold a meeting on Wednesday, April 17, 2024, at 6:00 p.m. at the Douglas County Courthouse, Room 216, located at 1036 SE Douglas Avenue, Roseburg, Oregon 97470. The agenda meeting agenda can be located at: www.dcso.com/dogboard In compliance with ORS 192.610 to 192.690, we will accommodate any member of the public who wishes to watch the meeting. To view the live stream or post meeting recording, please visit: https://video.ibm.com/channel/douglascountyoregon. Please contact the Sheriff's Office located in Room 210 of the Justice Building at the Douglas County Courthouse, 1036 SE Douglas Ave. Roseburg, OR 97470 541- 440-4449, if you need an accommodation.

entry.title: Grants boost staffing for wildland firefighters
entry.summary: To boost the number of firefighters across Oregon before wildfire season, the Oregon State Fire Marshal announced it has awarded $6 million in grants to 191 local fire agencies across the state.
